body: Needs a rebase.
Rebased and extended this. Smudges, resources and weapon sprites are still not covered so it won't detect https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8020 yet.
Nullified everything, rebased and also found the next missing sequence crash regression. The thief had misnamed sequences for take cover.
I decided to split off the sequence error fixes from the refactorings to keep an overview.
Otherwise :+1: / :white_check_mark:
Updated the sequences a bit. The definitions seem to be completely bogus.

The prospect of testing all these sequence and make animation changes (which nobody had noticed / filed bugs about being bogus before) puts me off reviewing this.  Are they really necessary, or can they be deferred to a later PR?

They will make the linter error and subsequently fail all builds so I had to include them. The make animation changes only refer to civilian buildings which have none, but the traits demand it. As they are not buildable, it never regressed to the players in the default mods. This cleans up the previous mess.
The YAML part of the changes looks OK, but the is soooo much changed in the code :X

It was just a grind task. Add `[SequenceReference]` before sprite sequence fields and extract them if they were hard-coded and then I had to fix the errors the linter spit out. The YAML part is the one that is hard to review because of the inheritance, not the source code.
needs a rebase
Will do so once https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7982 has been merged to also cover that trait.
#7982 was merged.

There is another complication that this will need to handle: traits that can switch between different image definitions (e.g. `RenderSprite.RaceImages`, `RenderHarvester.ImagesByFullness`).  You will need to have a *Info interface that the lint pass can query to get an IEnumerable<string> of potential images, and then check the sequences for each.
Filed https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8223.
Rebased.
This now covers more cases (also race images and several images per actors) than I wanted to test in the first revision to be merged, but okay.

This is now a monster PR :S
Please split some more stuff out into separate PRs to facilitate reviewing.
So far I've noticed the changes to `Parachutable`, however small (and only concerning the `Parachute` effect), need 2 upgrade rules, and include YAML changes in a lot of places. That would be a good PR on its own, I think.
Depends on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8412 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8296 now.

Rebased.

This detected the following new regressions from recent MiniYaml rule refactorings:

```
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Sprite image doggie from actor doggie does not define sequence prefix prone- from field ProneSequencePrefix of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.TakeCoverInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Sprite image cyborg from actor cyborg does not define sequence prefix prone- from field ProneSequencePrefix of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.TakeCoverInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Sprite image cyc2 from actor cyc2 does not define sequence prefix prone- from field ProneSequencePrefix of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.TakeCoverInfo

OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Sprite image dog from actor dog does not define sequence prefix prone- from field ProneSequencePrefix of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.TakeCoverInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Warning: Sprite image zombie from actor zombie does not define sequence prefix prone- from field ProneSequencePrefix of OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.TakeCoverInfo
```

which proves my point: This is badly needed and I want to see it integrated and all rule simplifications rebased upon so future cleanups don't add new crashes.

Got this when attacking with a zombie:

```
Exception of type `System.ArgumentNullException`: Argument cannot be null.
Parameter name: key
  at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentNullException (ExceptionArgument argument) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[System.String,OpenRA.Graphics.ISpriteSequence].FindEntry (System.String key) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[System.String,OpenRA.Graphics.ISpriteSequence].ContainsKey (System.String key) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.ReadOnlyDictionary`2[System.String,OpenRA.Graphics.ISpriteSequence].ContainsKey (System.String key) [0x00008] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Primitives/ReadOnlyDictionary.cs:67 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.SequenceProvider.HasSequence (System.String unitName, System.String sequenceName) [0x0003a] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/SequenceProvider.cs:81 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.Animation.HasSequence (System.String seq) [0x0000e] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/Animation.cs:169 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.WithInfantryBody.Attacking (OpenRA.Actor self, Target target) [0x00020] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Render/WithInfantryBody.cs:98 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.WithInfantryBody.Attacking (OpenRA.Actor self, Target target, OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Armament a, OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Barrel barrel) [0x00004] in /home/oliver/devel/openra/git/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Render/WithInfantryBody.cs:104 
```

Both ants and zombies (in ra) are missing the proper `AttackSequence` in `WithInfantryBody`.
Also, in TS every infantry attack I've tried causes the same crash as above. Isn't this lint check supposed to catch exactly this, or am I misunderstanding the purpose?
What @obrakmann said, but :+1: once those issues have been adressed.

> Isn't this lint check supposed to catch exactly this, or am I misunderstanding the purpose?

Probably a regression from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8171/ and other pull requests that were merged while this was ignored. I added more `[SequenceReference]` tags to bring those in line again.

If the default sequence is `null`, that is a valid rule. The game should either define a default or not crash in that case. I added a fix for the `ArgumentNullException`.
Updated again. I should now also account for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7638.
[Changelog](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog-%28bleed%29/_compare/ca1b0b41906f4b9bd1a0248a5813fd7ca77934b0%5E...ca1b0b41906f4b9bd1a0248a5813fd7ca77934b0)
Thanks! That was one hell of a cleanup :+1:
Yep, I invested a lot of time, but I think it was worth it.

I just came across this [code](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Graphics/DefaultSpriteSequence.cs#L48-L56).
With this PR there shouldn't be any more need for that exception silencing, right?
In fact, we can now afford to be less lenient about such issues and just crash.
